meanings.definition: To make six copies or six times as much
meanings.sent1: I will sextuplicate this document for everyone in the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She decided to sextuplicate the recipe to share with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The photocopier was feeling overwhelmed trying to sextuplicate all the papers.
meanings.sent4: His laughter seemed to sextuplicate in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The artist's talent allowed her to sextuplicate the beauty of the sunset on canvas.

meanings.definition: Sixfold; six times as much or as many
meanings.sent1: The sextuplicate amount of candies made the children's eyes widen in delight.
meanings.sent2: They were amazed by the sextuplicate number of stars visible in the clear night sky.
meanings.sent3: The sextuplicate servings of cake at the party left everyone happily full.
meanings.sent4: Her joy was like a sextuplicate rainbow after the storm of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with a sextuplicate array of colorful flowers in full bloom.
